samples.question: What is your favorite type of food?
samples.transcript: Oh, I am not a picky eater, so I can eat most types of food, but my favorite one would be Vietnamese traditional food, especially because I love how the cooks combine fresh ingredient with wonderful herbs and spices to create mouthwatering perfect dishes. >> Wonderful. Well done.

Well done.

samples.question: Do you prefer eating at home or in restaurants?
samples.transcript: Oh, I prefer eating at home because I want to cook for my family. I am confident about my wonderful skills of cooking which I learned from my stunning mom and I am passionate about cooking for my stunning family, the people I love most in the world. >> Wonderful. Well done.

samples.question: And the final question, has your diet changed compared to when you were younger?
samples.transcript: >> I think it has changed a lot. When I was a kid, I would not say that I hated vegetable, but I did not like it because I think that only her animals eat plants. But now when I understand the importance of vegetable in your diet, I started to eat more salad and vegetable. >> Thank you. Well done. That brings us to the end of part one. Now we will move on to part two. I will give you a question and you have one minute to prepare. Okay, thank you.

I want to ask how important are teachers in the process of learning. >> I would say the teacher plays an important role in learning not only because they act as a guidance and a mentor to their child learning process but also they provide emotional care and support for children. samples.question: Do you think job satisfaction is more important than salary?
samples.transcript: >> No, I do not think so. For most people in Vietnam, salary is first thing to take into account when you apply for a company, which company salary is important because Vietnam is a developing country and with the high salary you earn, you can take care of your family financially and it provides you financial freedom which is important. that you can live a better life especially in Hima city a thriving metropolis. >> Wonderful. Well done.

samples.question: Ask Langan, how has work culture changed in your country in recent years?
samples.transcript: >> Personally, it depends on the location. in thriving metropolis such as Soin city, work had switched to factories and office because of the education population. But personally I think yes because it is makes you understandable about the culture of the company and also you have more vocational skills. It will enhance their productivity ch jobs and customer satisfaction as great employees know how to make a customer feels good. >> Fantastic. Well done. And that brings us to the end of the test. Congratulations, Lang. Well done. I am so proud of you. I am so proud of you.

samples.question: Do you work or are you a student?
samples.transcript: >> I am a college dropout, actually. But the funny thing is I have applied to another university and I have been already accepted. So I am starting my bachelor's degree again in September. I also have a part-time job as an instructor. >> All right.

samples.question: What kinds of computer games do people play in your country?

samples.question: >> Do you think that all computer games should have a minimum age for players?

samples.question: In what ways can technology in the classroom be helpful?
